channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Kamala Harris secures enough delegate votes to be Democrat presidential nominee, says she will officially accept next week
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Van driver arrested after crashing into gates outside Irish prime minister's office in Dublin
item.description: In Dublin, a driver was arrested for crashing his van into the gates of several government buildings, including the residences of Ireland's president and the prime minister, early Friday morning. The incidents, which occurred around 2 a.m., resulted in no injuries.

item.title: US justice department sues TikTok, accusing the company of violating a children's online privacy law
item.description: The Justice Department sued TikTok, accusing it of violating children's online privacy laws and breaking a previous settlement with the FTC. The lawsuit focused on allegations that TikTok collected personal information from children under 13 without parental consent. TikTok's failure to comply with COPPA led to millions of children accessing the regular app, exposing them to adult content.

item.title: Kamala sounds like a third grader...': VP's 'word salad' on diplomacy slammed. Vance says...
item.description: "This is just an extraordinary testament to the importance of having a president who understands the power of diplomacy and understands the strength that rests in understanding the significance of diplomacy and strengthening alliances," Kamala Harris said. Republicans said this is what Kamala sounds like when there is no script for her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Everything, and nothing, is black and white in US elections
item.description: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Trump says Zuckerberg called, apologized for 'censoring' photo: 'He's not gonna support a Democrat'
item.description: "First he called me after the incident (assassination bid) and said it was very brave. He actually announced he is not gonna support a Democrat because he can't because he respected me for what I did that day. What I did that day was a normal response to me. But I was called by Mark Zuckerberg yesterday, the day before on the same subject and he actually apologized and said that he had made a mistake..."Trump said adding that nobody called from Google.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If a leader leaves, another will arise': Hamas chief Haniyeh's last words before assassination in Israeli strike
item.description: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in an Israeli strike in Tehran after quoting a Koranic verse to Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei. His death marks the third assassination of a Hamas leader by Israel in two decades. Haniyeh advocated resistance against Israel and strengthened Hamas' ties with Iran to bolster military capabilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Biden says 'you're stuck with me for another 100, 90 days'. 'There's no way out
item.description: As President Joe Biden and vide president Kamala Harris welcomed the three freed hostages from Russia, Biden told reporters 'you're stuck with me as president for a while, kid'. "There's no way out, OK? You've got me for at least another 100, 90 days or so," Biden said when he was asked how important it was to secure the release as he is not running for re-election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK police brace for planned far-right protests
item.description: UK police prepared for more far-right protests after a mass stabbing killed three young girls in Southport. Security tightened at mosques due to fears of anti-Islamic attacks. Prime Minister Starmer condemned agitators and promised legal action. Demonstrations are expected across various cities, including London and Cardiff, with authorities ready to respond.

item.title: 'Disappointing...disgusting': Donald Trump's son on cousin's book; Mary shuts him down
item.description: Donald Trump's son Eric Trump said it's disappointing that Fred decided to 'cash in' less than 100 days before the election. Eric said his father Donald Trump provided endless financial support to Fred for his son's treatment but Fred decided to forget everything for some quick buck. Fred's journey down memory lane includes when he heard uncle Donald to say the N word, when uncle told him that he should let his disabled son die and then move to Florida etc. Fred also said he would vote for Kamala Harris as his uncle is 'atomic crazy'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US extends hiring cooldown while unemployment highest since 2021
item.description: The US job market showed significant cooling in July with a rise in the unemployment rate to 4.3 percent, its highest level since late 2021. The economy added 114,000 jobs, down from June's revised figure of 179,000. This development brings the Federal Reserve closer to considering its first post-pandemic interest rate cut.

item.title: France demands release of citizen Vinatier held in Russia
item.description: France demanded Russia release French researcher Laurent Vinatier following a significant prisoner exchange. Vinatier faces up to five years in prison after pleading guilty to not registering as a foreign agent. The French foreign ministry also called for the immediate release of other arbitrarily detained individuals in Russia as they welcomed the release of 16 prisoners.

item.title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen in attack on Judges' escort in Northwest Pakistan
item.description: Militants attacked a convoy of judges returning home after duty hours in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, on Friday. No casualties or injuries were reported as police engaged the attackers. This incident is part of a surge in terror attacks in the region, with Pakistan witnessing 1,514 such attacks in 2023, resulting in 2,922 casualties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Now that Jennifer Aniston is such a...': Megyn Kelly on Imane Khelif row
item.description: ​Journalist Megyn Kelly slammed at actor Jennifer Aniston questioning her silence on Italian boxer Angela Carini who was hit by Algeria's Imane Khelif triggering the biggest row of Olympics 2024. Imane has been alleged to be a 'biological male' but she has been participating in women's match. With the issue raging on social media, Megyn Kelly said she is looking forward to Jennifer Aniston's comments like the actor weighed in to slam Republican senator JD Vance's comments on 'childless cat ladies'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Senior leader of Imran Khan's party shot dead in Lahore
item.description: A senior leader of former prime minister Imran Khan's PTI party, Dr Shahid Saddique Khan, was fatally shot in Lahore after Friday prayers. Four unidentified assailants attacked him outside a mosque. Despite being taken to a hospital, he succumbed to his injuries. A special police team has been formed to investigate the incident.

item.title: At least two policemen killed in terror attack on judges' convoy in northwest Pakistan
item.description: Two police officers were killed and two others injured in an ambush by terrorists on a judges' convoy in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Despite tight security, militants attacked while the convoy was en route from Tank district courts to Dera Ismail Khan. Clashes continued between police and militants. The judges remained safe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jailed former Pak PM Imran Khan's party vows to form 'grand opposition alliance' against ruling PML-N govt
item.description: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan, currently jailed, approved the expansion of Tehreek Tahafuz-e-Ayin-e-Pakistan to form a grand opposition alliance against the incumbent government. PTI leaders, addressing reporters, called for a strong opposition movement and criticized the current government for high power bills and inflation. The opposition plans a major rally in Swabi on August 5.

item.title: Russian drone hits bus in Kharkiv region, injuring six, official says
item.description: A Russian drone attack in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Friday injured six construction workers, with one critically injured, according to the regional governor. The incident occurred near Derhachi, close to where Russia began a new offensive in May. Ukraine halted the advance with reinforcements after Russia pushed into the border areas.

item.title: European Holocaust Remembrance Day for Sinti and Roma
item.description: In 1944, Nazi forces executed around 4,300 Sinti and Roma prisoners in Auschwitz-Birkenau, marking the end of the 'gypsy camp.' The European Union commemorates this event on August 2 as the European Roma Holocaust Memorial Day. Survivors like Christian Pfeil continue to share their stories, emphasizing the importance of remembering this genocide to prevent history from repeating itself.

item.title: How does China’s ‘no first use’ nuclear proposal align with its growing nuclear capabilities?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
